New Records: Jason Holder returned career-best figures of four for seven.
Key Match Events: Brandon King scored an unbeaten half-century.
Sheldon Cottrell dismissed Jason Roy with a full toss.
Tom Banton edged Jason Holder to slip, where Nicholas Pooran took a fine low catch.
Moeen Ali hit his first ball straight to backward point.
James Vince hit two fours and a top-edged six off Cottrell.
Vince cracked the last ball of the same Cottrell over straight to the fielder at cover.
Dawson pushed an Akeal Hosein delivery to Pollard and was run out by Shai Hope.
Brandon King and Shai Hope guided West Indies to 50 without loss in the ninth over.
Post-Match Reflections: Kieron Pollard said, 'Tough times don’t last, tough people do.'
Eoin Morgan complained about the opposite conditions faced compared to their warm-up fixture.
Liam Dawson reflected on the wicket and the need to learn and put a better score on the board.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Kensington Oval.
West Indies had lost eight of their last nine Twenty20 internationals before this match.
England's innings saw them reduced to 49 for seven before a rally from Chris Jordan and Adil Rashid.
